metadata.title: CVE-2021-2226 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Information Schema). Supported versions that are affected are5.7.33 and prior and 8.0.23 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to allMySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Confidentialityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-router - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.25-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
